paragraphs.text: The cover features Sokka holding his meteorite sword with Team Avatar and Piandao's castle in the background.

paragraphs.body: Sokka, the Sword Master (ISBN 978-1-4169-5491-0) is a literary adaptation of the episode "${link_0}".
paragraphs.text: Sokka, the Sword Master (ISBN 978-1-4169-5491-0) is a literary adaptation of the episode "Sokka's Master".

paragraphs.body: When Sokka feels bad that he is not a master of anything unlike ${link_0} the ${link_1}, ${link_2} the ${link_3}, and his own sister ${link_4} the ${link_5}, he decides to master the sword. Disguising himself as a citizen of the ${link_6}, Sokka convinces ${link_7}, the master Fire Nation swordsman, to teach him the art. Piandao puts him through a series of exercises in order to prove himself, and eventually, Sokka is deemed a worthy sword master, but when he suddenly confesses to being from the ${link_8}, an angry Piandao challenges him to a duel.
paragraphs.text: When Sokka feels bad that he is not a master of anything unlike Aang the Avatar, Toph the earthbender, and his own sister Katara the waterbender, he decides to master the sword. Disguising himself as a citizen of the Fire Nation, Sokka convinces Piandao, the master Fire Nation swordsman, to teach him the art. Piandao puts him through a series of exercises in order to prove himself, and eventually, Sokka is deemed a worthy sword master, but when he suddenly confesses to being from the Water Tribe, an angry Piandao challenges him to a duel.
